description: Nginx Ingress Controller via Prometheus Metrics Dashboard created for DevOps Nirvana @ https://github.com/DevOps-Nirvana

panels.description: This is the total number of requests made in this period (top-right period selected)

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{ controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[${__range_s}s]))

panels.title: Requests (period)

panels.description:
This is the percentage of successful requests over the entire period in the top-right hand corner.

NOTE: Ignoring 404s in this metric, since a 404 is a normal response for errant/invalid request.  This helps prevent this percentage from being affected by typical web scanners and security probes.
panels.title: % Success (period)

panels.description: This is the number of new connections made to the controller in the last minute.  NOTE: This metric does not support the Ingress, Namespace variables, as this is at a lower-level than the actual application.  It does support the others though (Env, Controller Class, Pod)

targets.expr: sum(avg_over_time(nginx_ingress_controller_nginx_process_connections{state=~"active", state=~"active",  controller_class=~"$controller_class", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Conns (2m)

panels.description: The number of HTTP requests made in the last 1 minute window

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{ controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Reqs (2m)

panels.description:
This is the percentage of successful requests over the last minute.

NOTE: Ignoring 404s in this metric, since a  404 is a normal response for errant requests

targets.expr:
sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{status!~"[4-5].*", controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) / 
(sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{ controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) - 
(sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{status=~"404|499", controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) or vector(0)))

panels.title: % Success (2m)

panels.description: This is the number of successful requests in the last minute.  Successful being 1xx or 2xx by the standard HTTP definition.

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{status=~"(1|2).*",  controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) or vector(0)

panels.title: HTTP 1/2xx (2m)

panels.description: This is the number of 3xx requests in the last minute.

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{status=~"3.*",  controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[2m]))  or vector(0)

panels.title: HTTP 3xx (2m)

panels.description: This is the number of 4xx requests in the last minute.

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{status=~"4.*",  controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval]))  or vector(0)

panels.title: HTTP 4xx (2m)

panels.description: This is the number of 5xx requests in the last minute.

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{status=~"5.*", controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) or vector(0)

panels.title: HTTP 5xx (2m)

targets.expr: sum by (geoip_latitude, geoip_longitude, geoip_city) (count_over_time({pod=~"$pod"} | json | http_host=~"$virtual_host" | geoip_longitude != "" | geoip_latitude != "" | __error__="" [$__interval]))
topk(100, sum by (geoip_org, geoip_country_code) (count_over_time({kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" | __error__="" [$__interval])))

panels.description: This is a total number of requests broken down by the ingress.  This can help get a sense of scale in relation to each other.

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{ controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) by (ingress)

panels.title: HTTP Requests / Ingress

panels.description:
The breakdown of the various HTTP status codes of the requests handled within' this period that matches the variables chosen above.

This chart helps notice and dive into which service is having failures and of what kind.

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{ controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval])) by (status)

panels.title: HTTP Status Codes

panels.description: The total number of HTTP requests made within' each period

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{ controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Total HTTP Requests

panels.description:
This graph can help assess and help us meet SLA requirements as far as the responsive time of our services.

For a more detailed latency graph broken out by ingress please open the closed tab at the bottom because it is very CPU intensive.
panels.title: Latency (Average Percentiles)

panels.description:
This graph can help assess and help us meet SLA requirements as far as the responsive time of our services.

For a more detailed latency graph broken out by ingress please open the closed tab at the bottom because it is very CPU intensive.
panels.title: Latency Heatmap

panels.description:
NOTE: This does not work per ingress/namespace

This is the number of new connections opened by the controller

targets.expr: sum(increase(nginx_ingress_controller_nginx_process_connections{state=~"active",  controller_class=~"$controller_class", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: New Connections Opened (Controller / Ingress Pod)

panels.description:
NOTE: This does not work per ingress/namespace

The total number of connections opened to our ingresses.  If you have a CDN in front of our services, it is not unusual for this to be very low.  If/when we use something like websockets with a persistent connection this can/will be very high.

targets.expr: sum(avg_over_time(nginx_ingress_controller_nginx_process_connections{state=~"active", state=~"active",  controller_class=~"$controller_class", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[$__range]))

panels.title: Total Connections Open (Controller / Ingress Pod)

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_request_duration_seconds_bucket{status!="404",status!="500", controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[5m])) by (le, ingress))

histogram_quantile(0.95, sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_request_duration_seconds_bucket{status!="404",status!="500", controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[5m])) by (le, ingress))

histogram_quantile(0.90, sum(rate(nginx_ingress_controller_request_duration_seconds_bucket{status!="404",status!="500", controller_class=~"$controller_class", ingress=~"$ingress", namespace=~"$namespace", controller_pod=~"$pod", exported_namespace=~"$target_namespace"}[5m])) by (le, ingress))
{kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" | line_format "{{ .http_host }}{{.request_uri}} status: {{.status}}"

topk(100, sum by (request_uri) (count_over_time({kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} !~ `\.ico|\.svg|\.css|\.png|\.txt|\.js|\.xml|synthetic-monitoring-agent` | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" | request_uri != "/" | request_uri != "/status"  __error__="" [$__interval])))

topk(100, sum by (http_referer) (count_over_time({kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" | http_referer != "" and http_referer !~ ".*?\\*\\*\\*.*?" | __error__="" [$__interval])))
topk(100, sum by (http_user_agent) (count_over_time({kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" |  __error__="" [$__interval])))
topk(100, sum by (remote_addr, geoip_country_code) (count_over_time({kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" | __error__="" [$__interval])))
topk(100, sum by (geoip_country_code) (count_over_time({kubernetes_pod_name=~"$pod"} | json | http_host =~ "$virtual_host" | __error__="" [$__interval])))

title: Kubernetes Nginx Ingress Prometheus Requests
